s.text: They will not try to tell you that the Lincoln Bedroom sleepovers were really about old friends dying of cancer.
They will not try to tell you that the Lincoln Bedroom sleepovers were really about old friends dying of cancer.
"Ted, I'm struck by how many people are looking at dots, connecting them where there's no evidence to connect them.
What is odd is that the Clinton administration, spin-happy as it is, doesn't seem to have any sense of which kinds of spin are effective and which only make matters worse.
That evening, on Nightline , Davis repeatedly told an incredulous Ted Koppel that Clinton's note about sleepovers was meant to refer to friends and supporters.
Having proved that he is a sentient human being, he subtly points his questioner in a different direction--weren't practices similar to this one actually common under previous presidents?

They regularly asked people to stay at the White House ...

Asked a direct question, Lewis immediately changes the subject to some other issue, like gun control.
